meanings.definition: The food of the gods in Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: In Greek myths, abrosia was the special food that only the gods could eat.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the freshly baked bread was like abrosia to her senses.
meanings.sent3: The chef's signature dish was so delicious, it could rival abrosia from Mount Olympus.
meanings.sent4: The scent of the flowers in the garden was like abrosia for the soul.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the ripe strawberries was so divine, it felt like abrosia on the tongue.

meanings.sent5: The warm apple pie was like abrosia, bringing comfort and joy to all who tasted it.

meanings.sent2: She savored every bite of the abrosia, enjoying the sweetness of honey and crunch of nuts.
